El_Warmachine tag:www.codexed.com,2005:Post/31992 2010-11-10T20:22:39-08:00 2010-11-10T20:22:39-08:00 when my love comes down <p><object width="380" height="285"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/Ii5a1omiHFc?fs=1&amp;hl=en_US"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/Ii5a1omiHFc?fs=1&amp;hl=en_US" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="380" height="285"></embed></object></p> <p>Christ.<br/> I hate to get all serious, because right now “all serious” is the last thing i need to be getting about anything right now.<br/> But.<br/> I think i may have a bit of a dilemma. Or, something that could quite easily become a dilemma if i don’t sit down and get really honest with myself and the two men that seem to be playing a fairly signifigant role in my life at the moment.</p> <p>Here’s my problem. <br/> On the one hand, we have Inuk. If you’ve been reading recently, you know he is the Friend whom i’ve known for almost 20 years, and with whom i’ve been having really incredible, fantastic, incomparably amazing sex with for the past couple months.<br/> He’s razor-sharp, witty, acerbic, funny, and an amazing artist, although he’d flip me the finger if he heard me call him that in front of anyone else.<br/> We’re not in a “relationship”, but we are very close friends and i love him.<br/> I may even be <i>in love</i> with him.<br/> (Whatever the fuck THAT means…)<br/> But.<br/> He’s not the sort that a girl can very easily imagine having any kind of viable future with, as in having things follow any kind of usual, conventional progression of co-habitation and such.<br/> He drinks. Kind of a lot. Maybe not the best thing for me. <br/> He isn’t very good at the whole Boyfriend thing. He has no real ambition, he’s difficult.<br/> But i understand him. I KNOW him, better than any other man on the planet. <br/> This is because we are a lot alike. <br/> I’m also not very good at the whole Girlfriend thing.<br/> I like my autonomy. I like my freedom. I like not having to answer to anyone.<br/> And the sex is…<br/> Well. <br/> And when i say i may even be “in love”, well - at one point in history we actually said those words to each other.<br/> A long time ago. <br/> It’s never entirely died, at least for me. But that doesn’t mean i want marriage, kids, house, blah blah blah.<br/> Frankly, i’m not entirely sure what i want.</p> <p>Right now, my life is in serious flux. And what Inuk and i have right now is just about all i am able to handle, when it comes down to it. </p> <p>Then, we have Miller (Or, AM). <br/> Now, Miller and i share in common a recent tragic death. Nearly a year ago, his wife died.<br/> Nearly five months ago, i lost my son.<br/> Miller is responsible, intelligent, older; he’s sweet and funny and quirky. <br/> He’s the head of the Lit department at a private high school.<br/> I find him attractive, but in a very different way than Inuk. <br/> There is no gut-twisting DESIRE, with Miller. <br/> He’s not dangerous, in the way Inuk is. <br/> If things progressed, he’d take the conventional route of courting, engagement, marriage, stability…<br/> In other words, the type of guy i never go for.<br/> But have always been curious about.<br/> Because, to be perfectly honest, i think maybe one day i’d LIKE that kind of stability.<br/> At least…part of me thinks so.<br/> (Mimi would pointedly remind me at this juncture that i have “anti-contentment issues”, and that she’s been telling me for years now that i have to treat my instincts in reverse; meaning, if i’m gut-wrenchingly attracted to a man, i should run the other way. If he doesn’t make my pulse race, and i merely “like” him, i should seriously consider dating him. But i digress).<br/> And he wants to date me.<br/> But i know he’s not ready. He is trying to be, because he really likes me a lot, and is very attracted to me. <br/> When i saw him this evening, he drove me home after a quick bite and stopped the car and told me he’d like me to come over some night to hang out…the implication being it would not just be “burgers”. <br/> I told him, “Well, let’s just see what happens…take things one day at a time, OK?”<br/> “Yes, i have been, i think i’m a lot more ready than i was a couple months ago…” (we’d had an actual date, and things got a little physical, but neither of us were able to go through with it. Our minds were, respectively, elsewhere).<br/> And then he said, <br/> “I find myself thinking about you a lot…”<br/> “Miller! That’s sweet! That’s good, i mean i…i like hanging out with you, too…”<br/> And then i sort of got tongue tied because i thought about Inuk and my brain just shut down.<br/> What the Hell is going on?</p> <p>I know Miller would be a great person to be in a relationship with. I like him, i actually do.<br/> When i type that, i know it to be true.<br/> Before things started heating up with Inuk and i, Miller was the guy i was drawn to, if in a kind of strange, confused way, since it was so close to Jamie’s death, and most of why we became close was because we shared a tragedy in common.<br/> However, that’s the whole thing - his wife has only been dead a year, this month. My son’s been gone five months. <br/> To me, the whole thing seems a bit precipitous.<br/> And i’m not ready to dive into anything with anyone, apart from what i’ve got going on with Inuk.</p> <p>It’s too soon.</p> <p>Inuk is exciting and fantastic and all, but he’s also familiar.<br/> Comfortable.<br/> I know what to expect.<br/> And i also know that my feelings for him need closer inspection.<br/> Or rather, they just need time to breathe.<br/> Most likely, if i were to get all serious on him now, he’d not know what to do.<br/> But if we just keep going as we are, and let things just develop naturally, who knows?</p> <p>The thing is, i can see that i’m being given a choice, when and if i’m ready for it, between stability, contentment and calm with a sweet, emotionally strong man whose feelings i’d never have to question and who makes me feel wonderfully good about myself, and a not-so stable (at least financially - i think he’s worse off than me) situation with my best guy-friend, for whom i have intense (yet familiar) feelings and unbelievably incredible chemistry with. Who makes no demands on me but is always there for me when i need him. And who also frustrates me and drives me bloody crazy, sometimes. And with whom i might actually be in love…</p> <p>Gaah! Stabbing bloody eyes out!</p> <p>Right now, the whole thing is just freaking me out.<br/> When Miller said that to me tonight , i felt myself internally going <i>whoa</i></p> <p><i>Oh my god, please…please just kill the motor a minute! Too much, too soon!</i></p> <p>And i need to be very clear about that with him. <br/> Do i like him? Yes. Do i think we could have a good time dating? Yes.<br/> And i know he’d treat me like a queen, and all those nice things.<br/> But. I’m not ready for this with him. <br/> And this could get way too complicated if i’m not careful. In fact, it seems it already IS getting complicated.<br/> Because while i DO have a nice time with Miller when we hang out, to be honest, i’m just not ready to stop things with Inuk.<br/> Not at all. I’m having way too much fun. <br/> I believe that, especially now, there is a big part of me that truly <i>needs</i> the raunchy, dirty, mattress-killing honest to goodness <i>fucking</i> that i’m getting with Inuk.</p> <p>And i’m really not much for juggling two men.<br/> I can barely handle one. <br/> And anything more serious in my life than what i’ve got going on with Inuk, well it’s just way, <i>way</i> too soon for me.</p> <p>Sigh. I hate these fucking situations. <br/> I frankly don’t know how the Hell i get myself into them.<br/> I wish i could click my heels, twitch my nose, do the little Genie head-shake and make everything simple.</p> <p>Yeah. And i’d also like a pony.</p> Selkie tag:www.codexed.com,2005:Post/31990 2010-11-10T18:06:57-08:00 2010-11-10T18:06:57-08:00 QFT Wednesday <p>I'll just be one of those people who you had during a rough time, someone you could talk to and would listen, someone there. Pt. 2 <p>...But before it got very weird, I said this:</p> <p>@: Lisa! I almost just died a terrible death in the ER! Terrorists were throwing terrorist chairs and terror stools and terrible couches and other sit-y things! And I got hit! And I have a bruise! But I didn't die because I have very dateable qualities such as: being strong, being a good listener, caring about the same shit you care about and, most importantly, having an average sized penis!</p> <p>So I embellished the story with terrorists and average sized penises, don't judge me.</p> <p>I had to make Chair Fest '10 as epic as my creative brain-juices could allow. My chair-to-the-head story had to be so awe-inspiring and Indiana Jones Worthy that Lisa would have no other recourse than dropping her panties and going Penthouse Letters on my ween.</p> <p>Or I'd just settle for a pity fuck.</p> <p>Or she could just lay there.</p> <p>Whatev.</p> <p>In the end, after I had told the story at least 8 different ways (One involved me single handedly stopping an armed jewelery heist and another where I fended off nazi-pirates with nothing but a fork, some pencil eraser and a prayer), I eventually revealed the kinda, sorta truth: </p> <p>I am Batman.</p> <p>That seemed to do the goddamn trick.</p> <p>She kissed me. 4 times. Just the right amount of tongue. Just the right amount of grind-age. God, I love that woman. Sometimes I wish I could curl up inside her ass like a warm little Snuggie and hibernate for the rest of my days. Or until she had to shit. What I'm trying to say, minus that weird part about the Snuggie and fecal matter, is that I was thrilled. </p> <p>I'd have taken at leeeeast 6 more chairs to the head for her.</p> <p>But then it got weird. You know, my cliffhanger from laster-Gag?</p> <p>Lisa: @, holy shit. I have to tell you what I did last night. Ok, this is weird and everything and I don't know how it happened really...But last night I got drunk with my best friend SARA...And we kissed each other. We made out a little bit.</p> <p>Now immediately, before my mouth opened to reply, my PENIS and my BRAIN had this conversation:</p> <p>PENIS: Me want to go inside pretty girl.</p> <p>BRAIN: Don't be a dick, Penis! Do not rise to this occasion! THIS IS A BAD THING! You thought it was hard to get with her before??? Just think about having to deal with boys <i>and</i> girls!!! And where does she get off making out with her bff??? I have been trying to make out with her since we broke up!!! Penis, we must make an example of her!!! You must...Not...Get...Haaaaaaard!!!"</p> <p>PENIS: Me feeling a growth spurt cumming!</p> <p>BRAIN: Penis! You ass!</p> <p>Who knew my PENIS and BRAIN had such compelling and double entendre conversations? And that's when I said:</p> <p>@: What about <a href=http://whoregagger.codexed.com/2010/06/03/be-yonce-belief>Beyonce</a>???</p> <p>Lisa: Don't get weird about this. It was just a thing! It just happened! I wasn't being, like, a dirty slut or anything. I have known SARA since I was 12. We are best friends.</p> <p>@: Fine! Then we can be best friends too! I'd love to be your best friend! We can best friend it up! Makin' out and whatnot like two best friends!</p> <p>What I just said there? That best friend bit? That was about to bite me in the ass. I'll segue by saying that Lisa is not an idiot. Lisa is, in fact, very smart. But have you ever been around someone long enough that you kind of take for granted their smart-ness? Like you sort of forget that they're intelligent until BAM! one day they just say some mother-fucking shit that rocks your world?</p> <p>This was one of those times. Because she said:</p> <p>Lisa: WAIT! Hold the fucking phone! 2 years ago you told me that you and I could <i>never</i> be best friends because you didn't want me to start thinking of you like a brother or a weird cousin or something! You said that! Yeah, I just caught your ass!</p> <p>Holy. Fucking. Shit.</p> <p>She got me! She really fucking got me! All the bullshit philosophy I've said to her over the 4 years I've known her...SHE ACTUALLY REMEMBERS IT! What the goddamn hell??? How could my own sayings and teachings betray me at such a crucial, bi-sexually odd moment???</p> <p>God I hope this kissing chicks thing is just a phase.</p> <p>Or that she at least tapes it and gives me a copy.</p> <p>I do get lonely, you know.</p> WhoreGagger tag:www.codexed.com,2005:Post/31389 2010-11-09T14:16:23-08:00 2010-11-09T14:16:23-08:00 Chairs Attack! <p>Yesterday I was attacked by a raging, meth-addicted psychotic.</p> <p>He threw a chair at my face.</p> <p>How many other Codexed journals can you read today that have that catchy of an opening, huh? That was like the Jaws of openers, wasn't it? Bitch just got ate. But don't get me wrong, I'm not gloating over here. I'm not better than you because I almost got chair'd to death. I mean, have you ever been attacked by a raging, meth-addicted, chair throwing psychotic? </p> <p>It only sounds like fun.</p> <p>It all started when I was at work delivering this certain item down to the ER. I was having a nice little walking jaunt, working on my plans involving the ingenious and stupidity reaching Jelousy Testousy Saga and thinking about sparrows, fig newtons, rainbows and casual relations with attractive strangers. </p> <p>The usual, in other words.</p> <p>But as soon as I opened the ER doors, this happened:</p> <p>CHAIR --------------------------------> @</p> <p>I got a chair thrown at my face.</p> <p>It was actually the back of my head, because I turned suddenly, but still.</p> <p>My first intial thought wasn't "Wow! That chair hurt my back and head area very badly" it was "Wow! That chair looks exactly like the ones I used to sit on in 5th grade!" And it was true! That thing was the same orange, plastic, 3-slits down the back chair that held every grade school kids ass from 1975 to 1990.</p> <p>Flashback, baby!</p> <p>Sadly, I was quickly shoved very violently from my childhood 80's history when I noticed the aforementioned raging, meth-addicted psychotic who threw the chair. He was, by then, now throwing his bed, table and lamp. What a champ! It took about 6 police guards to subdue the crazy bastard. It was kinda funny, in a very disfunctional and arousing way.</p> <p>Maybe that was just my chair'd head talking.</p> <p>I was questioned by the Po-Po who asked if I was alright and whether or not I wanted to press charges. And I was questioned by a few Hospital Administration Boys who seemed to be taking this far more seriously than I was. Hell, I was already thinking about Gagging it here on Codexed. I knew I was going to throw in a Jaws reference too. To prove that, here's the text I sent © right after getting into my chair-y squabble:</p> <p><center><img src="http://i790.photobucket.com/albums/yy187/thegaggers/chair.jpg" border="0" alt="Chair'd!"></a></center></p> <p>There was only one more way to make this chair throwing day even more epically inclined. And hopefully you can guess how: by using this sob-story to try and impress Lisa in the hopes of making out with her.</p> <p>And that's just what I did.</p> <p>Only thing was, things were about to get very weird...</p> WhoreGagger tag:www.codexed.com,2005:Post/31386 2010-11-09T13:25:54-08:00 2010-11-09T13:25:54-08:00 blood, guts and attack-squirrels <p>Imagine, if you will, starting your day off with this news the moment you walk into work:</p> <p>“I have to run! Hannah got attacked by a squirrel!”</p> <p>Hannah is big-sister of Piglet, incidentally. As we were giggling maniacally (once we knew she was not missing an eye or seriously hurt - just a scratch), all i could think of is how Jamie would have fallen on the floor in hysterics (after making sure she was alright, of course). </p> <p>“A <i>squirrel</i>? Who gets attacked by SQUIRRELS??”</p> <p><img src="http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1058/5161720647_814d6216e3_m.jpg" width="240" height="227" alt="evilsquirrel2" /></a><br/> <i>Evil Squirrel</i></p> <p>She’s at the doctor’s office getting tetanus shot as i write this. Poor kid. <br/> Apparently, she was throwing away a coffee-cup in a garbage can on the street - when she lifted up the lid, she and the squirrel startled each-other. She screamed, the squirrel screamed, then jumped on her face.<br/> She’s laughing about it though, in typical Hannah-Style. </p> <p>So, as one might expect, that was just the start to a very bizarro day indeed.<br/> After the squirrel-fiasco, i decided it would be a perfect day to take Piglet to this gigantic park, which is about an hour away on foot. I love to walk, Piglet loves to be escorted around in his stroller, so off we went on our adventure. We were also meeting the little Pug, the newborn who is to be my next Nannying gig, and his mom. <br/> Now, if you’ve been paying attention (you have, haven’t you??), i’m currently surfing the Crimson Wave (sorry, Male-Tribe people, but there you have it). I’m not sure if i’ve mentioned it before, but i don’t bleed like a normal person. <br/> Whereas most women lose the equivalent of a shot-glass of blood per day, i lose about the equivalent of a 5th of Scotch.</p> <p>So, the whole idea of walking for nearly an hour with no public restrooms in sight (it’s a residential neighborhood) is a fairly dumb one. But see, here’s the thing; i’m losing such vast quantities of blood that my reasoning is a bit impaired. I’m rather like an incredibly vapid cheerleader after doing gravity-bong hits followed by an afternoon of bingeing and purging. <br/> So anyway, of course i think this little adventure is a good idea and off we go. Everything is going fine, Piglet is having a blast, the Pug is sleeping most of the time, i get to talk to Mother of Pug, it’s all just peachy. <br/> Until it’s time to walk home.<br/> I hit Western, which is about 1/16th of my walk back, and realize that i’ve had a malfunction of the feminine hygiene-product variety. Of course, it’s like 65 degrees out today so everyone’s out walking around enjoying the weather, and i’m in jeans and a t-shirt. </p> <p>This is not looking good. </p> <p>And of course, there is nowhere for me to go except home. And anyway, since i grabbed Piglet’s backpack, and i have the attention-span of a 3-day old colt on acid, i didn’t bring any extra thingies to staunch the niagra-falls-like torrent of blood. <br/> So, pretty soon, i’m walking down the street looking like this:</p> <p><img src="http://t2.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcS23gu_nCi8M5fjsHVYLV2ZgtSMcJbzKwRAdYegCKBRMav5JRQ&t=1&usg=__U6nNBRYtisANkjryatyrQ-487Bc="></a><br/> <i>Me, bleeding</i></p> <p>And i’m pushing a stroller with a 30 lb toddler in it and there’s about 35 minutes of walking ahead of me. So what do i do? <br/> I start sending graphic texts to my friend Alaska, who is, of course, a guy. </p> <p><i>Me: Why does God hate me?</p> <p>A: Um…what?</p> <p>Me: I’m at Western/Lunt & just bled through my fucking jeans. I have a long, gross walk ahead of me :(</p> <p>A: Ugh. Anything i can do? From my apartment like, 40 minutes away?</p> <p>Me: Take my uterus out & stab it with a spear until it dies?</p> <p>A: Um, wow, no lunch for me. You never want to see another Fig Newton again. What a fool you were to think Fig Newtons were in the same UNIVERSE as an actual cookie! <br/> Give me cookies…<br/> COOKIES!!!</p> <p>It’s kind of like that. <br/> So you see, my little Kumquats, it’s all relative. <br/> And until you have experienced the mutual desire to lick the sweat off each-others’ post-coital bodies like it’s frosting and not, well, <i>post-coital sweat</i>; or you manage to go at it for hours, like Rabid Bunny-Rabbits on Methamphetamines even after a night of little sleep and too much alcohol; or the very sight of the other person doing something utterly mundane like sweeping the floor or cooking eggs at midnight sends you careening into a Pavlovian Lust Response, then you have not had Cookies. <br/> You have been subsisting on Fig Newtons. </p> <p>You have not experienced SCIENCE. </p> <p><img src="http://t2.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRlg8VkKPV_Ldv5Q9HaVmIGgtqEv5MKHIBgCdnXDH9a4_6WOHM&t=1&usg=__7tnE_pgIDCnydHLltfBGa9Uj0ww="></a><br/> <i>Me - Never The Same Again</i></p> <p>PS - can somebody tell me why, when you google images of “cookies cartoon”, you get about 75,000,000 pics of girls giving blowjobs? Like when Stephanie Tanner confided in Uncle Jesse when she found out the school bully was being abused by his father on Full House. Or when Will accidently made Carlton overdose on speed and had to confront the family when Uncle Phil was being a major dick on Fresh Prince.</p> <p>I want to tell you about this dream I had. </p> <p>Now dreams and whatnot are not my specialty. I've got an upwards of about 3,000 words and nothing but great concepts and ideas that I daydream about all day at work, but a sudden, massive Sociology project just got slapped onto my damn plate on top of another 15-page paper (for a goddamn 101 class) that are all due in December. College has proven to be a fair breeze up until now, and the pressure's never bothered me. It's just that when I do a paper, I don't half-ass it like the snot noses I'm surrounded by, so by the time I've gotten to sit down at Nano again, my brain is already fried gray-matter mash with a side of onions.<br/> <br/> I don't think I'll finish Nano this year. It's my first shot and well, I can honestly say I do love to write, but I lack a certain discipline that most hardcore writers seems to have. I get amazing story ideas (some of which I'm sure a few of you have been exposed to), but I tend to like my social life and how it kind of inspires me to write instead of hunkering down in front of a keyboard and praying to the great literary gods with coffee and nicotine sacrifices that an idea will develop in time. I'm still glad I at least joined and got an idea what to do and who else is in it to win it. I can see this story not being done this year, but I'll use what I have and build upon throughout the seasons either way - because I honestly think that this story has some great potential in becoming something even bigger. <br/> <br/> Anyway, just to keep myself motivated, and at least the concept of my Nano story in my head fresh, I'll give you a quick synopsis:<br/> <br/> Travis Wright is 25, newly wed, college educated, and eager to strike out into the world and start his family fresh when he's recruited by an elite "people finding" service. The idea of being a private investigator alongside some of the nation's best connections has Travis excited that he'll be successful and fairly well to due until he realizes that his mentor and supervisor is an estranged, sociopathic, gun-totting mad man who uses extortion and blackmail to get the information he needs to satisfy clients. As the adventures to find the adopted daughter of a very wealthy client who gave her away at birth takes them deeper and deeper into the rabbit hole, Travis begins to have suspicions that his mentor, Dresden, has a hidden agenda and might be pocketing a little extra on the side for something bigger than anyone can imagine.<br/> <br/> Dresden is 30. A Special Operations war veteran, a smooth talker, and a man who believes that "Sometimes ya gotta do the wrong thing to get the right thing going." He's the kind of guy that would shoot you to save the trouble of suffering... after he was the one to shoot you the first time in the name of getting the job done anyway. He is the best of the best at locating people with discretion in mind. He treats the world like his own personal war zone and will stop at nothing to get his man for the distinguished company he works for, even if it means bending the rules to the point where the stress might break them. Ever since Dresden's return from a brutal deployment in the South America, he's been different and he knows it. Now he's using his skills in the covert and deadly to rake in one of the biggest contracts of his career. There are a few scores he has left to settle in the meantime and God help anyone standing in his way. At. All.</p> <p>Now, The Friend (i really have to find another way to refer to him - which will give him a grand-total of THREE noms de guerre in this journal, unless i drop The Friend, which i will do starting now. Now he shall be known as Inuk.) <br/> Anyway, Inuk and i were having a drink and flirting outrageously (but subtly, at least we seem to think so). <br/> I was In A Mood, because after the dentist, my day took a bit of a nose-dive; i had to call California’s Vital Records Dept. AGAIN to see if Jamie’s death certificate is available yet (since his death was under investigation, it’s taking a while. Obviously, this whole process is difficult for me, and i had my boss over my shoulder shooting questions and trying to be helpful, but really just made me feel like i was going to lose my mind). <br/> So by the time i hit the Pub, i was ready to cry/kick someone in the teeth. <br/> So Inuk and i talked, or rather i vented and he listened; i got it all off my chest and was able to relax and enjoy my wine. <br/> Since i have a Pavlovian response to Inuk (a combination of his ability to just listen to me, kindly, then do something to make me feel better like make a sick joke or sling his huge arm around my shoulder and whisper something hilariously insulting mixed with the fact that he’s built like an Ox and could break me in two, but won’t), by the time i’d finished my first glass and was calm again, i was ready to drag him into the back room and gnaw on his clavicle.<br/> I made some vulgar crack about needing to test out the viability of my new, chip-free teeth on various parts of his anatomy, which sort of sent us into this downward spiral of raunchiness and side-comments geared to make the other one flush with embarrassment and/or wildly frustrated, while at the same time keeping our voices low enough so that no one else around us can actually hear.<br/> Well, since The Devil was one of those people, Irish Car Bombs quickly became part of the equation.<br/> On a good day, one of those is enough to make me quite happy indeed. Poured on top of Novocaine, i was done for.</p> <p>Once it was time for Inuk to walk me home, i was fully in “You’d Better Molest Me On The Way Or I’ll Kill You” mode.<br/> Apparently, though, he and the Devil had plans to meet our friend S. at a pub a few blocks away. Or woman, for that matter.<br/> Lemurs, even. <br/> Rutting boars have got nothing on us.</p> <p>And i get off work in 15 minutes - which means i get to flaunt myself in front of him while he finishes his shift at the Pub.<br/> And because i now resemble the top picture much more than the other one, i expect him to fully take out his frustrations on me in the most vulgar manner possible. <br/> Amen.</p> <p>PS - Oh, and what did i learn?
